title: Heat exhaustion, jiu-jitsu and 'words as magic': How Australia centre James O'Connor was saved from himself
text:
Whenever James O’Connor joins Saturday’s Rugby World Cup quarter-final from Australia’s bench, his presence at this tournament is already a “miracle”.

That is the view of Ollie Pryce, the Englishman who has physically, mentally and spiritually rebuilt and re-programmed the Wallaby, a former boy-wonder of international rugby, over the past two years.

From heat exhaustion exercises in Iceland to hill-running on the Isle of Skye via Brazilian jiu-jitsu sparring in Manchester and lugging a boulder down the Gold Coast, Pryce’s methods have been integral to O’Connor’s remarkable comeback.
